result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Beth M. Mittelstadt was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to enter bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Follow all programming recommendations of agent.  Not eligible for ERP.

supervisions.notes: You are ordered to submit and comply with an assessment by the approved public treatment facility for your county of residence, as defined in s.51.45(2)(c), Wis. Stats and also complete Driver Safety Plan
PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED
PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURTS, ANY BOND POSTED MAY BE APPLIED

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM Defendant Beth M. Mittelstadt appeared by video in custody from TCI.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Beth M. Mittelstadt.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF49, 22TR822, 22TR823

State - plea to Ct 1 of 22CF49 w/out repeater. Dismiss Ct 2 and  22TR822, 22TR823. BAC .129. 18 months EC. 12 months ES. Consecutive to current sentence. Forf of $2,000 including blood draw. 3 year revocation of DL. AODA and driver safety plan. IID in any vehicle owed or operated. Conditions of ES: Absolute sobriety. Not to enter bars, taverns or liquor stores. Follow program recommendations of agent.  Not eligible for ERP. 
Atty Lundeen - that is the agreement. Parties will argue part of the sentencing.  DE - understands agreement.
Court - provides plea colloquy.
DE - enters Guilty plea to Count 1.
Parties stipulate to the facts.
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Accepts plea and finds DE guilty.
State - asks court to accept joint agreement. Argues for 93 days of jail credit.     Atty Lundeen - agrees court should accept joint agreement. Argues for 249 days jail credit not including today.   DE - makes a statement to the court.

Court orders -
22CF49 Count 1 -
18 months IC - WI State Prison System
Consecutive to current sentence
12 months Extended Supervision
Forfeiture of $2,000.00 
3 year revocation of DL 
IID in any vehicle owed or operated
AODA and driver safety plan  
93 days jail credit
Conditions of ES: Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to enter bars, taverns or liquor stores. Follow programming recommendations of agent.  
Not eligible for ERP 

22CF49 Count 2 - dismissed
22TR822, 22TR823 - dismissed
Treatment Opportunity Program Eligibility - Not eligible

11:01 AM Defendant Beth M. Mittelstadt appeared by video in custody from Taycheedah Correctional.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Beth M. Mittelstadt.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf and Attorney Lucas D. Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF49, 22TR822, 22TR823

DE - waives personal appearance. Would like to plea today.
State - plea to Ct 1. Dismiss Ct 2 and  22TR822, 22TR823. BAC .129. 18 months IC. 12 months ES. Concurrent. $2,000 forf including blood draw. AODA and driver safety plan. Lifetime revocation of license. IID.
Conditions of ES: Absolute sobriety. Not to enter bars, taverns or liquor stores. Follow recommendations of agent. Not eligible for ERP. 

Atty Lundeen - speaks of jail credit and sentence concurrent sentence. 204 days credit including today.
State - not entitled to credit if already rcvd credit on revocation case.
State - speaks of jail credit. 97 days.
Atty Lundeen - position on jail credit remains the same.
Court - provides plea colloquy
Parties have off record discussion
11:21 AM back on record. Attorney Lucas D. Arras present for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Lundeen - not appropriate to proceed today.  Asking for new plea date.
DE - agrees
Court - sets new plea date. Clerk to set up Zoom.

ARGN
State - Information was filed timely
Atty Lundeen - rcvd Information. Waive reading. Enters NG plea.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Plea hearing on September 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Beth M. Mittelstadt in court in custody. Attorney Jonathan Lundeen appears.  B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF49, 22TR822, 22TR823
Atty Lundeen - DE does qualify for PD. Has Complaint but no discovery. Would like a plea date. Asks if DE can appear via Zoom from Taycheedah.
State - notes Information was filed. Can take up ARGN at hearing on September 8th.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 11:45 am. Contains phone number for Public Defender's office.
to Transport for Court on August 1, 2022 at 11:45 AM

4:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Beth M. Mittelstadt appeared by video and without counsel. B. Bahr - Clerk 
State - DE wrote letter to him personally to which he did not respond. Does not agree to concurrent time. Consecutive time is the offer. 
Court - speaks of right of counsel
DE - will proceed without counsel. Speaks of charges and TR matters. Argues against consecutive time. Would like to get an attorney.
Court - asks Clerk to follow up on new counsel with SPD office.  Sets PTC date. Asks for Order to Transport.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Letter from Defendant to Judge Wagner
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
8:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Beth M. Mittelstadt in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Beth M. Mittelstadt. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF49, 22TR822, 22TR823
Court - notes Court has rcvd request to withdraw as counsel.
Atty Kelm - if withdrawal is granted asks for another ARGN date.
Court - notes Public Defender does not grant DE the request to choose her own attorney. Will grant one more counsel, if that doesn't work she will not rcv another.
State - no objection 
Court - sets new ARGN. Grants Atty Kelm to withdraw as counsel.
Arraignment scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
